newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela bolivar ends flat on Cenbnk dlr sales.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela bolivar ends flat on Cenbnk dlr sales.

text.p: The Venezuelan bolivar closed flat at 483.75/484.75 per dollar as the Central Bank sold dollars into the market, but the currency is expected to weaken in the coming week, traders said.
"The general feeling is that the bolivar will soften when the market opens Monday," said one trader at a large bank.

Venezuela's foreign exchange market is unusual in that the Central Bank is its largest single supplier of dollars, which blurs the difference between the Central Bank supplying liquidity and intervening.
